name: Physics Gone Wrong
description:
Physics Gone Wrong is an educational game developed in collaboration with the University of Melbourne for first year physics students.

In Physics Gone Wrong, students have the opportunity to break physics in controlled ways, while trying to meet physically significant goals. It directly targets common misconceptions in first year studies, by allowing students to 'discover' the solution through play. Students can play around with physical parameters using simple click and drag mechanics, or they they can calculate the solution to the level on paper, enter it into Physics Gone Wrong, and watch it play out in real-time.
